candidates.title: chore: release 0.5.1
candidates.body: This release _just_ bumps wasmtime to a version that builds on aarch64.

candidates.title: chore: update wasmtime
candidates.body: I'm hoping this will fix builds on linux/arm64.

candidates.title: Release fvm 0.5.0, fvm_shared 0.4.1
candidates.body: Technically, the fvm_shared release is a breaking change. But it won't impact any creates that actually _rely_ on 0.4.0 (the actors, and only the actors) and I just released it yesterday.

candidates.title: chore: release shared to propagate refactor
Optimize RLE+ decoding by 20%
candidates.body:
```
decode                  time:   [15.350 us 15.388 us 15.440 us]                    
                        change: [-19.388% -19.130% -18.910%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

decode_encode           time:   [30.458 us 30.542 us 30.659 us]                           
                        change: [-13.335% -13.014% -12.640%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
```

candidates.title: refactor: split encoding and blockstore into fvm_ipld_* crates
candidates.body:
- move `shared/encoding` into `ipld/encoding`
- move `shared/blockstore` into `ipld/blockstore`
- remove dependency on `fvm_shared` for all `ipld/*` crates

candidates.title: chore: release fvm_ipld_bitfield 0.4.0
candidates.body:
This version is incompatible with previous versions due to a few changed
function signatures, and stricter validation. Continue using 0.3.0 to
validate networks before nv16.

candidates.title: chore: release fvm_shared
candidates.body: This time, we're returning the right errors.

candidates.title: Add RLE fuzzing
candidates.body:
decode-encode loop is currently disabled due to https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/pull/409

I'm not happy with the directory structure, the cargo-fuzz requires
that there is a parent crate for every `fuzz` crate which makes things a bit
annoying.

candidates.title: chore: release everything
candidates.body: Otherwise we have two different versions.

candidates.title: chore: release fvm_shared 0.3.0
candidates.body:
It's a minor release because it removes something that shouldn't have
been exported in the first place (breaking change).

candidates.title: feat: switch to the new versioned manifest.
candidates.body:
1. If no manifest CID is passed, load the manifest from the system actor and assume "v1" for now. In the future, we'll likely use the network version to infer the manifest version.
2. If a manifest CID _is_ passed, assume it's a versioned manifest and use the specified version.

replaces #404

candidates.title: Improve AMT equivalance fuzzer
candidates.body: Remove simple AMT fuzzing as the equivalence fuzzer now does its work better.

candidates.title: Cleanup fuzz test naming and add equivalence AMT test
candidates.body: Change in the naming is because I plan add project specific prefix to fuzz targets within OSS-Fuzz

candidates.title: Fix AMT fuzzing
candidates.body: We need to setup CI for the future.

candidates.title: Release v0.2.1
candidates.body: Of the FVM, shared crate, and the sdk. Primarily, this completely removes the "identity" multihash feature.

candidates.title: chore: update test vectors
candidates.body: This adds the nv15 test vectors.

candidates.title: feat: add nv15 support to conformance test framework
candidates.body: Fixes https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/370.

candidates.title: remove `examples` subtree.
candidates.body: This was useful to demo components as they were being fleshed out in the first days, but it's outdated, we no longer use it, and it's confusing to have it here (and with that name). Removing this also allows us to simplify the workspace Cargo.toml.

candidates.title: fix: remove uses of Code::Identity and remove the multihash feature
candidates.body:
This feature is, to put it simply, very dangerous as it will panic when given more than 64 bytes of input. See https://github.com/multiformats/rust-multihash/issues/194

Given that all uses of the identity hash function should be special cased _anyways_, there's no reason to leave this foot-gun in place.

candidates.title: chore: use released actors in the conformance tests
Release 0.2.0
candidates.body:
- Initial nv15 support.
- Switches to the new IPLD libraries. Mostly hack-free at this point.

candidates.title: fix: use a different CBOR library
candidates.body:
Use a CBOR library that is tailored towards DAG-CBOR.

CIDs don't work as expected with Serde untagged enums, hence add a custom
implementation for the Pointer (de)serialization. That implementation works
similarly to the Serde untagged enum implementation.

First the data is deserialized into a common format that supports all types.
In our case that's `Ipld`, in Serde it's `Content`. Those are then converted
into the actual types the enum is using.

Directly converting from the serialized form into the concrete enum types is
not possible. One would need to try each of the possibilities sequentially
until one of them matches. The deserializer is consumed when deserializing,
hence it can only be used once. This is the reason to have the intermediate
step.

candidates.title: Support nv15
candidates.body:
Rebased for builtin-actors extraction.

Closes https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/335.
Closes #143.
Closes https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/336.

candidates.title: depend on v6 branch of actors.
prepare to publish crates; v0.1.0.
candidates.body:
- rename `ipld_{amt,hamt,car,bitfield}` to `fvm_ipld_...`. The `ipld_` namespace is taken by the original crates, and these forks depend on `fvm_shared`, so it's logical to namespace them under `fvm_`.
- add version numbers to all dependencies.
- add missing metadata to Cargo.toml.

candidates.title: extract actors to `filecoin-project/canonical-actors`
candidates.body:
This is the ref-fvm side of https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/issues/4. To be paired with the [`raulk/initial` branch](https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/tree/raulk/initial) on https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors.

- Removes actors code from this repo.
- Renames `{forest=>ipld}_bitfield`.
- Introduces the `actor::is_builtin_actor` syscall.
- Introduces the `actor::get_code_cid_for_type` syscall.
- Makes the Machine load Wasm bytecode from the blockstore.
- Makes `testing/conformance` import `builtin-actors` v6.
- Adds the `fvm_shared::actor::builtin` module with types to support the loading of builtin actor code and the resolution of CIDs.

candidates.title: feat: optimize actor loading
candidates.body:
- cache syscall linker and constructed syscalls
- cache "pre instantiated" modules

This reduces conformance test run time from ~600s to ~100s on my machine and significantly increases network sync performance.

candidates.title: fix: exclude test-vectors submodule from crate
candidates.body: Related to #344, but this doesn't fix it (see the linked cargo issue).
